TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed InputBin extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the input bin that is used as the source of blank paper or other print media.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The values of this type are used primarily for these purposes:
- As members of the <xref:System.Printing.PrintCapabilities.InputBinCapability%2A> collection, a property of <xref:System.Printing.PrintCapabilities>, they indicate the types of input bins that the printer supports.
- As the value of the <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket.InputBin%2A> property of a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket>, they instruct the printer to use the specified bin.
The F:System.Printing.InputBin.Unknown?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True value is never used in properties of T:System.Printing.PrintCapabilities?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True objects.
You should never set a T:System.Printing.PrintTicket?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True property to F:System.Printing.InputBin.Unknown?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True. If some other T:System.Printing.PrintTicket?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True producing application has created a PrintTicket document that sets the input bin feature to an unrecognized option, (that is, an option that is not defined in the [Print Schema](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=186397), then a T:System.Printing.PrintTicket?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True object in your application that is constructed with that document will have F:System.Printing.InputBin.Unknown?qualifyHint=True&autoUpgrade=True as the value of the P:System.Printing.PrintTicket.InputBin?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True property.
Although the T:System.Printing.PrintTicket?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True and T:System.Printing.PrintCapabilities?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True classes cannot be inherited, you can extend the [Print Schema](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=186397) to recognize print device features that are not accounted for in the T:System.Printing.PrintTicket?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True or T:System.Printing.PrintCapabilities?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True classes. For more information, see [NOTINBUILD: How to: Extend the Print Schema and Create New Print System Classes](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/a3600218-1ea5-478a-9853-6560464f2885).
## Examples The following example shows how to determine printer capabilities and configure the print job to take advantage of them.
[!code-cs[XpsCreate#PrinterCapabilities](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/XpsCreate/XpsCreate.cs#printercapabilities)] [!code-cpp[XpsCreate#PrinterCapabilities](../../add/codesnippet/CPP/xpscreate/XpsCreate.cpp#printercapabilities)] [!code-vb[XpsCreate#PrinterCapabilities](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/xpscreate/xpscreate.vb#printercapabilities)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Printing.InputBin AutoSelect = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The automatic selection of an input bin according to the page size and media output type.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Printing.InputBin AutoSheetFeeder = int32(4)

Docs.summary: The automatic sheet feeder is used.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Printing.InputBin Cassette = int32(2)

Docs.summary: A removable paper bin is used.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Printing.InputBin Manual = int32(5)

Docs.summary: The manual input bin is used.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Printing.InputBin Tractor = int32(3)

Docs.summary: A tractor feed (also called a pin feed) of continuous-feed paper is used.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Printing.InputBin Unknown = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The feature (whose options are represented by this enumeration) is set to an option not defined in the [Print Schema](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=186397).
